intro: Rinorea banguensis, commonly known as the Banguensis Rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
